projects.title: Image Segmentation using Pseudo Labels
projects.bodyText:
- Developed a weakly supervised image segmentation pipeline using pseudo-labels to reduce the need for expensive pixel-level annotations. 
 - Improve pseudo-label quality by interpolating standard and top-erased CAMs, followed by training a segmentation model under mixed supervision (strong + weak labels). 
 - Achieved segmentation performance close to fully supervised models by combining region-mined CAMs with as few as 10 strongly labeled images.

projects.title: Protein Subcellular Localization
projects.bodyText:
- Alignment-free, feature-based ML pipeline to predict eukaryotic protein subcellular localization, using only relevant biological features.
 -  Biological features such as (amino-acid and dipeptide composition, molecular weight, net charge, isoelectric point, GRAVY/hydrophobicity profiles, signal peptides, NLS/NES) used to train one-vs-rest XGBoost classifiers. 
 - Achieved 72.5% overall accuracy—strong performance for Extracellular (F1 0.93) and Other (F1 0.89) classes, with more modest results for Nuclear (F1 0.56) and Cytosolic (F1 0.67) predictions.

projects.title: Reducing sleep inertia by waking up from lighter sleep
projects.bodyText:
Created a smart-alarm app for iOS/watchOS that uses Apple Watch heart-rate and HRV data to detect sleep stages in real time and wake users during lighter sleep, reducing sleep inertia. 
 - Developed using Swift with Flask-hosted neural network—trained on PPG heart-rate data—to perform three binary classifications (Sleep vs Awake, Light vs Deep, REM vs Non-REM).  Models reached ~90% accuracy on Sleep vs Awake, ~85% on Light vs Deep, and ~70% on REM detection 
 - Part of my BSc thesis at Reykjavik University.

projects.title: Using Evolutionary Search Algorithms to Improve ADAS
projects.bodyText:
- Framework for automatic agent search, which uses evolutionary search algorithms to improve the performance of agents in various domains. 
 - Open-ended framework that can be applied to multiple domains, and it generates more powerful agents compared to the original ADAS framework. 
 - Reduces the cost of automatic agent search by a significant amount compared to ADAS, allowing more independent research in this field.
